III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4123 Education
Section (1) An institution shall not admit a child for care unless an
Description appropriate educational program can be provided.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Facility is not utilizing an appropriate virtual school to
educate/instruct the youth at their facility. MDE confirmed that
2nd Street Learning is not a legal school.
Investigation Interviews
On 02/25/2025 a virtual meeting was held to discuss educational
plan for youth placed at Whaley. Michigan Department of
Education (MDE) Consultant, Educational Planner 1,
Educational Planner 2 and myself were in attendance.
Educational Planner 1 and Educational Planner 2 both reported
that documentation submitted by Whaley relative to youth placed
at their facility indicated that youth were enrolled and attending 2nd
Street Learning for educational instruction. MDE Consultant
confirmed that 2nd Street Learning was not a legal school. MDE
advised that she would be scheduling and facilitating a meeting to
discuss the concerns with the legal status of the school and
enrollment of Whaley youth.
On 02/25/2025 special investigation was initiated on-site at
Whaley. An interview was completed with Educational
Supervisor, Compliance Supervisor, Director of Residential
and Program Manager 2. The Educational Supervisor confirmed
that school time frame is 9am to 2pm. She confirmed that 2nd
Street Learning is involved in the instruction of youth at Whaley
and further indicated that the program has had a positive impact
on the agency youth. All parties were advised of the allegations of
the special investigation. Educational Supervisor further
confirmed that some Whaley youth attend Grand Blanc Public
School, Lynden Charter Academy, Grand Blanc Community
Schools, Genessee School District or 2nd Street Learning.
On 02/25/2025 contact was made with Complainant and no
additional concerns were noted.
On 03/05/2025 an on-site meeting was held at Whaley to discuss
educational instruction of youth at the CCI. MDE Consultant,
Educational Planner 1, Program Manager, Program Manager
2, DHHS Analyst, DHHS Analyst 2, Chief Administrator,
Assistant Director of Special Education from Lansing Public
Schools and President of 2nd Street Learning. Chief
2

Administrator advised during the meeting that 2nd Street Leaning
is a contracted support service offered through Lansing Public
Schools. It was confirmed that the youth are not enrolled in 2nd
Street Learning, as they are not a legal school system. Youth are
enrolled in Lansing Public Schools. Chief Administrator also
confirmed that the agency staff had been incorrectly referring to
and documenting 2nd Street Learning as the school for youth at
Whaley. She also advised that youth that are enrolled in Lansing
Public Schools are educated using ingenuity virtual learning that is
facilitated on their school grounds under the direction of Lansing
Public Schools. It was also confirmed that appropriate special
education services are provided to the youth under the direction of
the special education program of Lansing Public Schools. Lastly,
the Chief Administrator advised that the agency was no longer
able to utilized the services of Flint Public Schools due to limited
resources and lack of certified teachers available for instruction.
On 03/12/2025 in person interviews were completed with Youth
A, Youth B and Youth C. Each youth reported being engaged in
educational instruction virtually onsite at Whaley. Students denied
any concerns and reported that they find the additional support of
2nd Street Learning to be beneficial for the most part.
Documents Reviewed
Whaley Daily School Report for 2024/2025 academic year -
Document list each youth in Whaley Program and documents
enrollment location and daily attendance. Report documents that
each youth is enrolled in either a Charter or Public School.
On 03/12/2025 Program Manager 2 sent a copy of the service
agreement between Lansing Public Schools and 2nd Street
Learning for review.
Tour of Agency and School
On 03/12/2025 a tour of the agency and tour of the grounds for
school were toured. No issues of concern were noted. School
area was found to be an appropriate setting for educational
purposes.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in compliance with the licensing rule. Interviews were completed
with agency staff, school staff and other involved professionals. It
was confirmed that the agency was incorrectly referencing 2nd
Street Learning as the enrolled school. Youth at the agency are
enrolled in a variety of confirmed educational institutions and 2nd
Street Learning is a contracted support agency for the students.
3

Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4130 Privacy and Confidentiality
Section (1) An institution shall assure resident and parent privacy and
Description confidentiality and shall protect residents from exploitation.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Agency failed to maintain confidentiality of youth by engaging
them in uncontracted agency for educational support services.
Investigation Interviews
On 03/12/2025 a virtual meeting was held to discuss the
education plan for youth at Whaley Children Service Program.
DHHS Analyst 1 expressed concern regarding confidentiality of
youth at the agency as it related to their involvement with 2nd
Street Learning Center. Whaley Program Manager was unable to
confirm whether or not agency was contracted to provide services
through Lansing Public Schools, but confirmed that an attempt to
obtain clarification would continue.
03/26/2025 an email correspondence was sent to Program
Manager requesting an update on confirmation of contract
between Lansing Public School and 2nd Street Learning in an
effort to confirm confidentiality. The Program Manager responded
and provided a copy of the contract for review.
Documents Reviewed
Contracted Service Agreement between Lansing Public Schools
and 2nd Street Learning. The agreement was signed on
04/01/2024. The agreement has several terms, including Section
XI that indicates Data Sharing Agreement.
Analysis At the completion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in compliance with licensing rule. It was confirmed that 2nd Street
Learning is contracted with Lansing Public Schools to provide
support services to students enrolled in their district.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
